case.name: Motor Trades Association of Australia Superannuation Fund Pty Limited v Rickus (No 4) [2009] FCA 1085 (24 September 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: statutory demand upon director for production of documents
request by company for copy of documents provided to regulator
duty of director to provide copy
liability owed by director to company practice and procedure
no general rule that discontinuing party should pay costs occasioned by discontinuance
potential to fragment the taxation process
referral of outstanding issues to mediation

citances.sentence: The litigation between the present parties has been ongoing for a considerable period of time. A number of judgments have already been given: Motor Trades Association of Australia Superannuation Fund Pty Ltd v Rickus [2007] FCA 1878 ; Motor Trades Association of Australia Superannuation Fund Pty Ltd v Rickus [2007] FCA 2117 ; Motor Trades Association of Australia Superannuation Fund Pty Ltd v Rickus (No 3) [2008] FCA 1986 , 69 ACSR 264 ; Motor Trades Association of Australia Superannuation Fund Pty Ltd v Rickus (No 4) [2009] FCA 1085. The facts giving rise to the litigation need not be now repeated.
